p:
By contrast, the amplitude of Q
IRy largely increases the energy barrier along the r 1 direction (31.7 meV at Q
IRy = −5.00 Å

μ
, and 23.8 meV at Q
IRy = +5.00 Å
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\sqrt{\mu }$$\end{document}
μ
). This is accompanied by a slight shift of the potential minimum along the − r 1 (−y) direction. The energy landscape is symmetric with respect to the mirror plane σ 1, and the energy barrier along the r 2 and r 3 directions are reduced (13.4 meV at Q
IRy = −5.00 Å
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\sqrt{\mu }$$\end{document}
μ
, and 10.1 meV at Q
IRy = +5.00 Å
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\sqrt{\mu }$$\end{document}
μ
). The change in energy barriers and the shift of the potential minimum indicate that the coupling of Q
LS and Q
IR modes exerts an anharmonic force on the Q
LS mode.
